## Example: One-Mode Network Visualization

Here's an example of creating a one-mode network visualization using R and igraph:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load required library
library(igraph)

# Create a sample one-mode network (e.g., collaboration network)
# Edge list format: who collaborates with whom
edges <- data.frame(
  from = c("Alice", "Alice", "Bob", "Bob", "Charlie", "David", "Emma", "Emma"),
  to = c("Bob", "Charlie", "Charlie", "David", "David", "Emma", "Alice", "Charlie")
)

# Create igraph object
g <- graph_from_data_frame(edges, directed = FALSE)

# Set transparent background
par(bg = NA)

# Basic visualization
plot(g, 
     vertex.size = 30,
     vertex.color = "lightblue",
     vertex.label.color = "black",
     vertex.label.cex = 0.8,
     edge.width = 2,
     edge.color = "gray40",
     layout = layout_with_fr(g),
     main = "One-Mode Collaboration Network")

# Calculate and display network metrics
cat("Network density:", graph.density(g), "\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Network density: 0.8 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cat("Number of nodes:", vcount(g), "\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Number of nodes: 5 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cat("Number of edges:", ecount(g), "\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Number of edges: 8 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cat("Average degree:", mean(degree(g)), "\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Average degree: 3.2 
```
